title: President Trump says Barron Trump is 'very hurt' by Charlie Kirk's death
shortDescription: President Donald Trump recalled Barron Trump wanting to meet Charlie Kirk, who co-founded the student organization Turning Point USA.

title: Judge blocks Trump admin's move to end Haitian migrants' protections
shortDescription: Federal ruling keeps deportation protections intact as Trump’s plan to end TPS for Haitians is deemed premature and unlawful.

title: What is Trump's approval rating and how does it compare across states?
shortDescription: President Donald Trump said he would send the National Guard to Memphis, Tennessee. What is his approval rating in the state? How does it compare?

title: UK, US to sign multibillion-dollar tech deal during Trump's visit
shortDescription: The agreement aims to bolster US-UK collaboration between trillion-dollar tech sectors, enhancing opportunities for businesses and consumers.

title: Fed's Cook never sought tax exemption for GA home as primary residence
shortDescription: Lisa Cook has repeatedly denied any wrongdoing regarding her properties, which include a home in Michigan, and a Massachusetts investment property.

title: Trump urges NATO nations to stop buying Russian oil, impose sanctions
shortDescription: Trump said he is ready to place “major” sanctions on Russia only if all NATO nations agree to do the same and if they stop buying Russian oil.

title: White House in agony as Trump, aides mourn slain activist
shortDescription: Charlie Kirk was more than just another MAGA ally to Donald Trump and his aides. The 31-year-old conservative was close to many in the White House.

title: Polish PM denies Trump suggestion that drone raid was a “mistake”
shortDescription: Donald Tusk, prime minister of Poland, dismissed the U.S. president's suggestion that the incursion by Russian drones could have been a mistake.

title: After Kirk shooting, members of Congress say they don't feel safe
shortDescription: Democrats canceled a town hall in Michigan, and a Republican congresswoman said she'll carry a gun in her home state.
